result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Mould was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 3/2/17: Court orders the Judgment of Conviction to be amended to give the defedant 2 additional days of jail time credit should the defendant's probation be revoked.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges including the DNA surcharge
--to maintain employment or pursue an educational program as directed by the Agent

--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as directed by the Agent

--to comply with all Family Court orders regarding child support

--to make all child support payments on time

--to make  payments on arrearages according to the Child Support Orders

--within five days of release from custody Mr. Mould is to report to the Child Support Agency at the Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 S. Center Avenue, Jefferson, Room 219, to complete a case management meeting. 

--to advise the Child Support Office of any change of address or employment within 48 hours of any such change

--all payments toward child support and arrearages are to be paid through the Wisconsin Support Collection Trust Fund, and not through the Department of Corrections

--not to leave the State of Wisconsin or the State of Illinois without court approval

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: Jefferson County Child Support Services

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
--on Count #1 only:  to serve 9 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges for employment, to commence forthwith

---Mr. Mould is required to serve this jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

**06/23/2017 - The Court orders that effective 7/21/17 at 3pm he can be released from the jail, the remainder of conditional jail will be stayed.
The Defendant will report back the Jefferson County Jail on or before 8/21/17 at 3pm to resume serving the conditional jail term.**

***9/5/17 - It is hereby ordered, pursuant to the stipulation of the parties, that Joseph Mould shall report to the Jefferson County Jail to finish his remaining condition of probation jail time on the 11th day of Septempber, 2017 no later than 7:00pm.***

[MA]Case called at 11:08am 
Defendant Joseph  Mould in court, in custody with attorney John Vernon Rhiel.  Susan Victoria Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Defendant's Motion to Waive Extradition:
--Atty. Rhiel gives argument
--DA Happ opposes motion 
--the Court questions Counsel

The Court orders: 
Effective 7/21/17 at 3pm he can be released from the jail, the remainder of conditional jail will be stayed
The Defendant will report back the Jefferson County Jail on or before 8/21/17 at 3pm to resume serving the conditional jail term. 

The Court addresses waiver of extradition with Mr. Mould; the Court finds waiver is being made freely, voluntarily,and intelligently.
Mr. Mould signs waiver in the presence of the Court; Court endorses document. 

recess: 11:35am
Waiver of extradition
Motion hearing on June 23, 2017 at 11:00 am.
enclosure letter from Atty Rhiel
TO ALLOW DEFENDANT TO WAIVE EXTRADITION

It is hereby Ordered pursuant to the stipulation of the parties, that the judgment of conviction in the above captioned case shall be amended to give the defendant 2 additional days of jial time credit should the defendant's probation be revoked.
re: Days Sentence Credit

Huber Law/Work Release Notification

[JK/MK] case called at 3:30pm. 
Defendant Joseph  Mould in court, in custody, with Attorney John Rhiel.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.  As part of the Defense arguments, Attorney Rhiel submits a packet of documentation.
Mr. Mould makes a statement.

On both Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Mould on Probation for 4 years, with conditions: 
--on Count #1 only:  to serve 9 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges for employment, to commence forthwith
---Mr. Mould is required to serve this jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as directed by the Agent
--to maintain employment or pursue an educational program as directed by the Agent
--to comply with all Family Court orders regarding child support
--to make all child support payments on time
--to make  payments on arrearages according to the Child Support Orders
--within five days of release from custody Mr. Mould is to report to the Child Support Agency at the Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 S. Center Avenue, Jefferson, Room 219, to complete a case management meeting. 
--to advise the Child Support Office of any change of address or employment within 48 hours of any such change
--all payments toward child support and arrearages are to be paid through the Wisconsin Support Collection Trust Fund, and not through the Department of Corrections
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin or the State of Illinois without court approval
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges including the DNA surcharge

Days credit for time already served:  271  days.  The Court requires that any stipulation or motion for additional sentence credit is to be filed by the Defense by the end of February.  
Felony firearm prohibition warnings are given.
recess 4:17pm.
Sentencing hearing on February 14, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
with Elements
Criminal Case Settlement

[JK] case called at 10:34am
Defendant Joseph Mould in court, in custody with Attorney John Rhiel. DA Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Mould, verifying that he understands and joins in the agreement. 
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " guilty " entered on counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated including as to repeater status; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Mould guilty on counts #1 and #2, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses count #3
On request of the Defense, the Court will schedule sentencing on a later date.
The Court revokes Bond
recess:10:43 am

NEXT: Sentencing to be scheduled-- Atty Rhiel is to contact JA to arrange a date during the week of Feb 13th or sooner.
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on February 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on February 2, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 1:45pm [ma]
Defendant Joseph  Mould in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

--no objection from ADA Shock

The Court directs the SPD to appoint new counsel.
The Court directs to have new counsel meet with Mr. Mould prior to next hearing date.

Case called at 11:36 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Joseph Mould in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that she is not in a position to resolve the matter at this time, nor able to make a decision about a trial at this time. In the process of obtaining medical records, requests a STC in 30 days and will be able to make a better determination at that time.
Upon questioning of the court, Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Mould is in-custody on a cash bond and on contempt order
DA Happ requests the matter be set for preliminary hearing; Atty Svehlek informs the Court that she has received discovery and it will be a waiver of preliminary hearing
Recess: 11:38 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Waiver of Preliminary Hearing 7/29/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices
The court concludes the request is timely and in the proper form. The court directs the clerk to request the assignment of another judge under Wis. Stat. 751.03
Notice of Hearing Cancellation
Status conference on July 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 1:25pm [mo]
Defendant Joseph Mould appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $500  CASH bond.
recess 1:29  pm.

[MK] case called at 3:19pm. 
Defendant Joseph Mould not in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court references a Conflict Review Worksheet in the file. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
ADA Hall indicates that there are warrants pending for Mr. Mould in a separate Jefferson County case, and in the State of Illinois for an extraditable offense.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court orders issuance of a Probable Cause Warrant for Mr. Mould- body only. 
recess 3:21pm.
